description: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) = number of partitions of n into distinct parts in which every part is >=k, for k=1,2,...,n.
comments: T(n,1)=A000009(n), T(n,2)=A025147(n) for n>1, T(n,3)=A025148(n) for n>2, T(n,4)=A025149(n) for n>3.A219922(n) = smallest number of row containing n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 01 2012
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..120 of triangle, flattened
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (tails)a026835 n k = a026835_tabl !! (n-1) !! (k-1)a026835_row n = a026835_tabl !! (n-1)a026835_tabl = map   (\row -> map (p $ last row) $ init $ tails row) a002260_tabl   where p 0      _ = 1         p _     [] = 0         p m (k:ks) = if m < k then 0 else p (m - k) ks + p m ks-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 01 2012
author: _Clark Kimberling_
